get.description: Get User Search Criteria from search history

post.description: To Add User Search Criteria to search history

get.description:
This API searches for tickets in your help desk.
You can provide multiple values separated by commas, and the search will be performed on the field using any of the provided values.

Learn more about search and how it works.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: The channel through which the ticket was received !@exact match@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

schema.description: The channel through which the ticket was received !@exact match@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

parameters.name: customerResponseTimeRange
parameters.description: Key that filters tickets in which customer responses were recorded in a particular period of time. !Enter the from and to dates in the ISO date format of yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ;! !For example,! customerResponseTimeRange=2017-11-05T00:00:00.000Z,2018-09-05T23:59:00.000Z2017-11-05T13:15:30.000Z,2018-09-05T13:15:30.000Z

schema.description: Key that filters tickets in which customer responses were recorded in a particular period of time. !Enter the from and to dates in the ISO date format of yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ;! !For example,! customerResponseTimeRange=2017-11-05T00:00:00.000Z,2018-09-05T23:59:00.000Z2017-11-05T13:15:30.000Z,2018-09-05T13:15:30.000Z

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the ticket !@wildcard search@!

schema.description: Description of the ticket !@wildcard search@!

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: SortBy can be: !@relevance@,! !@modifiedTime@,! !@createdTime@,!  !@customerResponseTime@! To specify sorting order, use as given below: !For descending order: sortBy=@-@modifiedTime! !For ascending order: sortBy=modifiedTime!

schema.description: SortBy can be: !@relevance@,! !@modifiedTime@,! !@createdTime@,!  !@customerResponseTime@! To specify sorting order, use as given below: !For descending order: sortBy=@-@modifiedTime! !For ascending order: sortBy=modifiedTime!

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The tag associated with the ticket !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

schema.description: The tag associated with the ticket !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

parameters.name: contactName
parameters.description: The name of the contact who raised the ticket !@wildcard search@!

schema.description: The name of the contact who raised the ticket !@wildcard search@!

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category of the ticket !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

schema.description: The category of the ticket !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

get.description: This API returns information from UserPreference for search.

patch.description: This API Updates UserPreference for search.

get.description:
This API searches for records in your help desk.
You can provide multiple values separated by commas, and the search will be performed on the field using any of the provided values.

Learn more about search and how it works.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: SortBy can be: !@relevance@,!  !@modifiedTime@,!  !@createdTime@! To specify sorting order, use as given below: !For descending order: sortBy=@-@modifiedTime! !For ascending order: sortBy=modifiedTime!

schema.description: SortBy can be: !@relevance@,!  !@modifiedTime@,!  !@createdTime@! To specify sorting order, use as given below: !For descending order: sortBy=@-@modifiedTime! !For ascending order: sortBy=modifiedTime!

get.summary: Global Search AvailableFields And Conditions-Experimental Api

parameters.name: module

post.description: Possible modules are products, possible conditions like 'starts with','is' and 'between',  possibile fields like Status,contact Id

get.description:
This API searches for the activities in your help desk portal.
You can provide comma-separated values, which will perform the search on the field using any of the provided values.

Learn more about search and how it works.

get.description:
This API searches for the events in your help desk portal.
You can provide multiple values separated by commas, and the search will be performed on the field using any of the provided values.

Learn more about search and how it works.

post.description: Possible modules are tickets, solutions, contacts, accounts, products, tasks, community, possible conditions like 'starts with','is' and 'between',  possibile fields like Status,contact Id are available in /api/v1/globalSearchAvailableFieldsAndConditions for more details

get.description: This API lists the fields in a particular module, whose values can be searched and retrieved.

parameters.description: Keyword or phrase to search

parameters.name: module
parameters.description: Module to search in: @tickets@, @accounts@, @contacts@ or @tasks@. The default response includes all modules.

schema.description: Module to search in: @tickets@, @accounts@, @contacts@ or @tasks@. The default response includes all modules.

customField5.descrption: To search for the values in a field, use the below format. !@customfield5=Field ApiName:search value@! This will compare the specified search values with the field's value and retrieve the matching results.  !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

customField6.descrption: To search for the values in a field, use the below format. !@customfield6=Field ApiName:search value@! This will compare the specified search values with the field's value and retrieve the matching results.  !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

customField7.descrption: To search for the values in a field, use the below format. !@customfield7=Field ApiName:search value@! This will compare the specified search values with the field's value and retrieve the matching results.  !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

customField8.descrption: To search for the values in a field, use the below format. !@customfield8=Field ApiName:search value@! This will compare the specified search values with the field's value and retrieve the matching results.  !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

customField1.descrption: To search for the values in a field, use the below format.!@customfield1=Field ApiName:search value@! This will compare the specified search values with the field's value and retrieve the matching results. !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

accountName.descrption: Name of the account associated with the ticket !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

customField2.descrption: To search for the values in a field, use the below format. !@customfield2=Field ApiName:search value@! This will compare the specified search values with the field's value and retrieve the matching results. !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

customField3.descrption: To search for the values in a field, use the below format. !@customfield3=Field ApiName:search value@! This will compare the specified search values with the field's value and retrieve the matching results.  !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

departmentId.descrption: ID of the department from which the entity must be fetched. If the ID is not passed, then searches in all permitted departments !@exact match@!

customField4.descrption: To search for the values in a field, use the below format. !@customfield4=Field ApiName:search value@! This will compare the specified search values with the field's value and retrieve the matching results.  !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

channel.descrption: The channel through which the ticket was received !@exact match@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

customerResponseTimeRange.descrption: Key that filters tickets in which customer responses were recorded in a particular period of time. !Enter the from and to dates in the ISO date format of yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ;! !For example,! customerResponseTimeRange=2017-11-05T00:00:00.000Z,2018-09-05T23:59:00.000Z2017-11-05T13:15:30.000Z,2018-09-05T13:15:30.000Z

productName.descrption: Name of the product associated with the ticket !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

_all.descrption: Key that includes all the columns in the tickets module for search !@wildcard search@!

limit.descrption: Specifies the number of tickets to be fetched. !@default : 10@!

from.descrption: The starting index for fetching results. !@default : 0@! !@starts from 0@!

dueDateRange.descrption: Key that filters tickets due in a particular period of time. !Enter the from and to dates in the ISO date format of yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ;! !For example,! dueDateRange=2017-11-05T00:00:00.000Z,2018-09-05T23:59:00.000Z

sortBy.descrption: SortBy can be: !@relevance@,! !@modifiedTime@,! !@createdTime@,!  !@customerResponseTime@! To specify sorting order, use as given below: !For descending order: sortBy=@-@modifiedTime! !For ascending order: sortBy=modifiedTime!

tag.descrption: The tag associated with the ticket !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

customField9.descrption: To search for the values in a field, use the below format. !@customfield9=Field ApiName:search value@! This will compare the specified search values with the field's value and retrieve the matching results.  !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

email.descrption: The corresponding email address associated with the ticket. example: 1. email=jack* 2.email=${notempty} 3.email=${empty} !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

productId.descrption: ID of the product associated with the ticket !@exact match@!

contactId.descrption: ID of the contact who raised the ticket !@exact match@!

contactName.descrption: The name of the contact who raised the ticket !@wildcard search@!

customField10.descrption: To search for the values in a field, use the below format. !@customfield10=Field ApiName:search value@! This will compare the specified search values with the field's value and retrieve the matching results.  !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

assigneeId.descrption: ID of the agent who is assigned to resolve the ticket !@exact match@!

accountId.descrption: ID of the account associated with the ticket !@exact match@!

phone.descrption: The phone number provided in the ticket !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

modifiedTimeRange.descrption: Key that filters tickets modified in a particular period of time. !Enter the from and to dates in the ISO date format of yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ;! !For example,! modifiedTimeRange=2017-11-05T00:00:00.000Z,2018-09-05T23:59:00.000Z

category.descrption: The category of the ticket !@wildcard search@! !@empty check@! !@not empty check@!

status.descrption: Status of the ticket inclusive of custom status. example: 1. status=open,in progress 2. status=${open}  !@exact match@!
